document.docAuthor: Sun, Xin, Zhang, Bing & Wu, Donghui
document.docTitle: Protaphorura changbaiensis Sun, Zhang & Wu, 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species and one new country record of Protaphorura Absolon, 1901 (Collembola: Onychiuridae) from northeast China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species and one new country record of Protaphorura Absolon, 1901 (Collembola: Onychiuridae) from northeast China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype female, 7 paratype females and 10 paratype males on slide, China : Jilin: Baishan: Fusong: near Changbai National Forest Park (alt. ca 750 m ,
42 ° 24 ’ N
,
128 °06’ E
),
10 July 2012
, soil, Liu Dong et al. leg.

Other material.
5 females
and
9 males
on slide, China : Jilin: Baishan: Fusong: Manjiang (alt. 850m ,
41 ° 57 ’ N
,
127 ° 34 ’ E
), 0
1 Sept. 2009
, soil, Wu Donghui leg.
Description. Body color white in alcohol. Size 1.45–1.80 mm in females, 1.30–1.55 mm in males; holotype 1.66 mm. Body slender and elongated.

Pseudocellar formula dorsally: 32 /012/ 33232 , ventrally: 1 (0)0/000/00000 (
Figs 19, 24
&
28
); subcoxa 1 of legs with 1 , 0, 0 pso respectively. Parapseudocellar formula ventrally: 00/000/ 100000 (
Fig. 24
); subcoxa 1 of legs without psx. Pseudopores formula dorsally: 00/011/
111100
, ventrally: 00/ 111 /0xxx00 (
Figs 19, 24
&
28
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 14–18. First instar larva of
Protaphorura bicampata (Gisin, 1956)
14, dorsal chaetotaxy; 15, antenna; 16, distal part of leg III; 17, ventral side of head; 18, Abd. II–VI sterna. Scales: 0.1 mm (14–15, 17–18), 0.01 mm (16).

FIGURES 19–24.
Protaphorura changbaiensis
sp. nov.
19, dorsal chaetotaxy; 20, PAO; 21, Ant. III sensory organ; 22, antenna; 23, distal part of leg III; 24, Abd. I–VI sterna (female). Scales: 0.1 mm (19, 22–24), 0.01 mm (20–21).

FIGURES 25–29.
Protaphorura bicampata
(Gisin, 1956)
25, posterior chaetae row of Abd. I tergum.
Protaphorura changbaiensis
sp. nov.
26, posterior chaetae row of Abd. I tergum; 27, central part of Abd. V tergum; 28, ventral side of head; 29, chaetotaxy of Abd. IV sternum. Scales: 0.1 mm (27–29), 0.01 mm (25–26).

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The name of the new species refers to the mountain range where it was found.
Ecology. Found in mixed coniferous and broadleaved forest.

Remarks. The new species shares the same pso formula of Abd. I–V terga ( 33232 ) as the Crimean species
P. ajudagi Pomorski, Skarżyński
& Kaprus’, 1998 and the Mongolian species
P. microcellata Dunger, 1978
.
